marketNews.title: Car Sales in October 2024 Highest During 2024
marketNews.content: The Association of Indonesian Automotive Industries (Gaikindo) reported that national wholesale car sales in October 2024 amounted to 77,191 units, a decrease of 3.9 percent year‑on‑year but an increase of 6.2 percent month‑on‑month, marking the highest monthly sales since the beginning of 2024. Although still lower than the previous year, the year‑on‑year decline has narrowed. The result brings total wholesale car sales for the first ten months of 2024 (10M24) to 710,408 units, down 15 percent year‑on‑year, representing 83.6 percent of Gaikindo's 2024 target, which had been revised down to 850,000 units. Gaikindo Chairman Yohannes Nangoi said the association targets national wholesale car sales to recover to 1 million units in 2025, supported by lower interest rates and the growth of electric vehicle infrastructure outside Java and Bali. In October 2024, Astra International (ASII) recorded a sales decline of 1.9 percent year‑on‑year, but still performed better than the industry average of a 3.9 percent decline. This resulted in ASII's market share rising to 56.5 percent (October 2023: 55.3 percent). Based on brand, Daihatsu supported ASII's wholesale sales in October 2024 with stable sales of 14,096 units (0 percent year‑on‑year, +11.2 percent month‑on‑month), while Toyota+Lexus reached 27,211 units (‑1.6 percent year‑on‑year, +6.3 percent month‑on‑month). Cumulatively, ASII recorded wholesale sales of 401,398 units (‑13.8 percent year‑on‑year) during 10M24, relatively better than the industry decline. Among ASII's main competitors, Mitsubishi posted the relatively best performance with sales of 7,900 units (‑3.3 percent year‑on‑year, ‑3.2 percent month‑on‑month) in October 2024, bringing its 10M24 sales to 82,187 units (‑9.3 percent year‑on‑year). Honda recorded the most negative performance among ASII's peers in October 2024 and 10M24. BYD achieved sales of 2,488 units in October 2024 with a market share of 3.2 percent, surpassing Wuling (2.9 percent) and Hyundai (2.2 percent). Key Takeaway: We estimate that the improving wholesale sales figure, which exceeded 75,000 units in October 2024 – the highest monthly level in 2024 – may be driven by increased demand from corporate fleet segments following political certainty after the cabinet announcement. Automotive stocks have already reflected the improving sales trend. Therefore, regarding the outlook for automotive issuers, investors should monitor wholesale sales over the next two months to see whether the figure can stay in the 75,000‑80,000 range per month and continue to improve. This is needed to assess whether the annual recovery to 1 million units in 2025 remains realistic or will be revised downward.

marketNews.title: AISI Reports Domestic Motorcycle Sales in October 2024
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI) recorded that domestic motorcycle sales reached 544,392 units in October 2024, a rise of 5.4 percent year‑on‑year and 3 percent month‑on‑month. During the first ten months of 2024, total sales amounted to 5.4 million units, up 3.4 percent year‑on‑year, representing 83‑87 percent of AISI's 2024 target range of 6.2‑6.5 million units.

marketNews.title: Indonesia and China Sign $10 Billion Deal at Business Forum
marketNews.content: Indonesia and China signed a $10 billion agreement during the Indonesia‑China Business Forum in Beijing on 10 November 2024. The two countries agreed to deepen cooperation in several sectors, including electric vehicles, lithium batteries, photovoltaics, and the digital economy. They also pledged to strengthen partnership in the global energy transition and to jointly ensure secure global mineral supplies and industrial chain stability.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Reports Consumer Confidence Index Drop in October 2024
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia reported that the Consumer Confidence Index (CCI) fell to 121.1 in October 2024, down from 123.5 in September 2024, marking the lowest level since December 2022. The decline was driven by a drop in the Current Economic Conditions Index to 109.9 (September 2024: 113.9) and a fall in the Consumer Expectations Index to 132.4 (September 2024: 133.1).

marketNews.title: Bitcoin Reaches All‑Time High of $81,899
marketNews.content: Bitcoin hit an all‑time high of $81,899 on Monday, 11 November 2024, amid positive sentiment following Donald Trump's victory in the U.S. presidential election and the election of several pro‑crypto candidates to the U.S. Congress. Previously, Trump pledged during his campaign to make the United States the "crypto capital of the planet" and announced plans for a strategic Bitcoin inventory, the appointment of a crypto‑friendly financial regulator, and the removal of SEC Chair Gary Gensler, who is known for a hard stance on digital assets.

tickerNews.title: INCO Announces Partnership with GEM Co. for $1.4 Billion HPAL Project
tickerNews.content: INCO announced a partnership with GEM Co., Ltd., a Chinese battery material producer, to build a High‑Pressure Acid Leach (HPAL) nickel smelter in Central Sulawesi valued at US$1.4 billion. The smelter is projected to produce 60,000 tonnes of nickel mixed hydroxide precipitate per year. Bloomberg reported that GEM Co. will hold up to 25 percent of the project, INCO will hold 30 percent, and the remaining equity will be owned by third parties to be announced later. In addition to the HPAL smelter, GEM Co. and INCO are also considering the construction of an anode and precursor plant.

tickerNews.title: TOBA (TBS Energi Utama) Acquires 100% of Sembcorp Environment Pte. Ltd. for SGD 405 Million
tickerNews.content: TBS Energi Utama (ticker TOBA) through its subsidiary SBT Investment 2 Pte Ltd signed an agreement to purchase 100 percent of the shares of Sembcorp Environment Pte. Ltd. from Sembcorp Industries Ltd. The transaction value totals SGD 405 million, approximately IDR 4.8 trillion. Sembcorp Environment Pte. Ltd. is an integrated waste management service provider in Singapore.

tickerNews.title: PSAB Announces New Gold Prospect Yielding 70,000‑100,000 Ounces Annually
tickerNews.content: J Resources Asia Pasifik (ticker PSAB) announced that a new gold prospect discovered in a subsidiary's mine is expected to produce approximately 70,000 to 100,000 ounces of gold per year for more than ten years, based on production simulation of optimized gold inventory potential and preliminary economic analysis. With this positive result, PSAB expects to promptly commence further drilling programs and other development activities.

tickerNews.title: KEJU Plans Bonus Share Distribution and Share Buyback
tickerNews.content: Mulia Boga Raya (ticker KEJU) plans to distribute bonus shares at a ratio of 4:11 from a capital surplus of IDR 206.3 billion as of 31 December 2023. The cum‑date is on the regular market and negotiation on 23 December 2024, with distribution on 20 January 2025. Additionally, KEJU intends to conduct a share buyback of 4.9 million shares (0.33 percent of total shares) with a funding allocation of up to IDR 7.5 billion, implying a buyback price of up to IDR 1,535 per share. Both proposals will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 17 December 2024.

tickerNews.title: HATM Plans Rights Issue of Up to 1.8 Billion New Shares
tickerNews.content: Habco Trans Maritima (ticker HATM) plans to conduct a rights issue of up to 1.8 billion new shares, which would result in a dilution effect of up to 20.45 percent. The issue price has not been announced, and the proceeds will be used for loan repayment and/or capital expenditures. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 18 December 2024.

tickerNews.title: KKGI Plans Interim Stock Dividend
tickerNews.content: Resource Alam Indonesia (ticker KKGI) intends to distribute an interim stock dividend at a ratio of 190:3 from treasury shares, valued at IDR 61.2 billion as of 31 December 2023. The cum‑date is on the regular market and negotiation on 30 December 2024, with distribution on 17 January 2025. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 18 December 2024.

tickerNews.title: AMRT Insider Budiyanto Djoko Susanto Sells 2.7 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: A commission member of Sumber Alfaria Trijaya (ticker AMRT), Budiyanto Djoko Susanto, sold 2.7 million shares of AMRT at an average price of IDR 3,306 per share on 5 November 2024. The total transaction value was approximately IDR 9 billion. After the transaction, Budiyanto's ownership in AMRT decreased from 0.335 percent to 0.328 percent.

tickerNews.title: RAJA CEO Djauhar Maulidi Purchases 2 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Rukun Raharja (ticker RAJA), Djauhar Maulidi, bought 2 million shares of RAJA at an average price of IDR 1,725 per share on 1 and 7 November 2024. The total transaction value was about IDR 3.4 billion. After the purchase, Djauhar's ownership in RAJA increased from 0.047 percent to 0.095 percent.

tickerNews.title: SGER Clarifies Coal Supply to Vietnam's Danka Minerals
tickerNews.content: Global Energy (ticker SGER) clarified to the Indonesia Stock Exchange that, based on an independent surveyor's assessment, SGER has supplied coal to its Vietnamese customer Danka Minerals Joint Stock Company (Danka) with specifications that meet the sales contract. SGER explained that, according to the contract, ownership and risk of the cargo transfer to Danka immediately after loading onto the vessel at the loading port. SGER also requested the Vietnamese Embassy in Indonesia to disregard Danka's claim and to facilitate dispute resolution by referring Danka to the Singapore International Arbitration Centre (SIAC). Previously, Danka, through Vietnam's Ministry of Industry and Trade, sent a letter to Indonesia's Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources alleging that SGER had falsified the calorific value of the coal shipped.

tickerNews.title: IFII Announces Interim Dividend of 5 Rupiah per Share
tickerNews.content: Indonesia Fibreboard Industry (ticker IFII) will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to IDR 47.1 billion, equivalent to 5 rupiah per share. The cum‑date is on the regular market and negotiation on 19 November 2024, with payment on 3 December 2024. Based on IFII's closing price on Monday, 11 November 2024, at IDR 204 per share, the implied dividend yield is 2.5 percent.

tickerNews.title: POWR Director Iwan Putra Brasali Purchases 1.3 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: A commissioner of Cikarang Listrindo (ticker POWR), Iwan Putra Brasali, bought 1.3 million shares of POWR at an average price of IDR 713 per share on 5 November 2024. The total transaction value was about IDR 916 million. After the purchase, Iwan's ownership in POWR increased from 0 percent to 0.0081 percent.
